sp:Content.sp:value: I saw this patient in the ED briefly along with Dr. Gladd. I interviewed and examined the patient myself. I have read through the resident chart. I have discussed the diagnosis, disposition, and plan with the patient. Please see the resident note for full details. HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Briefly, this is a 26-year-old female with asthma status, now on Flowvent and Acyclovir, and multiple other medications who has been having nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea x1 day. It sounds like a gastroenteritis. This has been going through her household, her mother had it recently. She has been unable to keep up with her fluid losses. At an outside institution, she was found to be very dehydrated. She received IV fluids and was transferred here. She had to go to the bathroom in the ER a couple times but did not complain of any pain. Her heart rate was down into 114 and her blood pressure was normal. She left the ER after IV treatment and antibiotics without incident for further management of her dehydration. DIAGNOSES: 1. Nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea. 2. Dehydration. Admitted to the ER in stable condition. For the rest of the elements, please see the documentation in Dr. Gladds note.
